The claim made by Lt: Gov. Dan Patrick at the "Back the Blue" news conference in Houston was that the city of Austin is now one of the most dangerous cities in America and definitely in Texas.
The context in which Patrick: s comments were made, at a "Back the Blue" event, suggests that he was referring to crime when he used the term "dangerous".
Criminologists interpreted Patrick: s use of "dangerous" to specifically mean violent crime, or crimes that threaten a person's physical safety.
When comparing Austin: s violent crime rates to those of other major U.S. cities, Austin ranked 28th among the 30 largest cities, with a rate of about 400 incidents per 100,000 residents. This ranking is significantly lower than cities like Detroit, Memphis, Baltimore, and Milwaukee, which topped the list in terms of violent crime rates.
